logic.premise: If both X and Z then it's not the case that Y.
logic.conclusion: If Y then either it's not the case that X or it's not the case that Z.

logic.premise: If either Y or X then it's not the case that Z.
logic.conclusion: If Z then both it's not the case that Y and it's not the case that X.

logic.premise: If it's not the case that Y then both Z and X.
logic.conclusion: If either it's not the case that Z or it's not the case that X then Y.

logic.premise: If it's not the case that Y then either X or Z.
logic.conclusion: If both it's not the case that X and it's not the case that Z then Y.

logic.premise: If either Y or Z then it's not the case that X.
logic.conclusion: If X then both Y and Z.

logic.premise: If it's not the case that either Z or Y then X.
logic.conclusion: If it's not the case that X then both Z and Y.

logic.premise: If X then both Y and Z.
logic.conclusion: If it's not the case that either Y or Z then X.

logic.premise: If it's not the case that Y then either it's not the case that X or it's not the case that Z.
logic.conclusion: If it's not the case that both X and Z then Y.

linguistic.premise: It was X that Y saw Z take.
linguistic.conclusion: Z was seen by Y taking X.

linguistic.premise: It was "X" that Y thought Z said.
linguistic.conclusion: Z was thought by Y to have said "X".

linguistic.premise: What Y gave Z was X.
linguistic.conclusion: It was X that was given to Z by Y.
It was to Y that Z told X.

linguistic.premise: It was "X" that Z thought Y said.
linguistic.conclusion: Z was thought by "X" to have said Y.

linguistic.premise: What Y gave Z was X.
linguistic.conclusion: It was Z that was given to Y by X.
It was to "X" that Z told Y.

linguistic.premise: It was X that Z saw Y take.
linguistic.conclusion: Y was seen by X taking Z.
